item.title: E3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:6, topic:344241”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=440619.msg3238166#msg3238166 date=1276657521]
gabe newell sayin steam comin to ps3[/quote]

Didn’t watch it but what’s the point? Orange box has been on ps3(and 360 for that matter) for bloody years.[/quote]

Gabe said, they are bringing Portal 2 to PS3 and that it is going to be the best version on any console (obviously PC will be better) - thanks to steam features being possible on the PS3 due to the open platform Sony provide, so automatic updates, steam cloud and probably some community features, maybe a distribution platform too (not as likely).

And as far as Valve are concerned The Orange Box isn’t on the PS3, EA poorly ported it over to the PS3 and at the time Valve didn’t want to develop for the PS3.

As for the conferences, Microsoft’s was shit, Nintendo’s and Sony’s were great. Though Sony’s had a short low point during the Move showing, but picked it up afterwards. Loved Nintendo’s - the best they have done in years.

Read full topic

item.title: E3
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I would have gone but

Welcome to Attendee Registration. Please note that E3 Expo is a trade-only event and is not open to the general public. Individuals who are not able to document their direct, and current professional affiliation to the interactive entertainment industry are not qualified to attend. If you are from the retail sector, you must be selected by your parent company to attend.

I have been watching it on G4 though, and I have to agree with sanga that Microsoft’s was shit, Nintendo’s was amazing, and Sony’s was awesome too. I can not wait for the 3DS, or Epic Mickey.

Read full topic

item.title: E3
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

portal 2 gameplay video

i like how they are still keeping it a puzzle game and not making it an action game (ie time sensitive shit), or at least, their goal is to.
portal prelude failed in that regard, i enjoy solving puzzles not spending 20 minutes trying to get my timing perfect
